title: About Me
text:
I am an Ag-Tech Professional working as a Postdoc Researcher at the University of Missouri. I specialize in Remote Sensing and Machine Learning applications for Agriculture. My work focuses on developing innovative techniques for precision agriculture, particularly in biomass estimation and canopy height sensing.
I strive to make great quality research and work extensively with R and Python. My passion lies in measuring grass for a living and contributing to sustainable farming practices. M-I-Z-‚Ä¶.. Z-O-U! üêÖ




Remote Sensing Applications: Satellite-based time-series analysis for agricultural monitoring
Machine Learning: Advanced algorithms for crop yield prediction and biomass estimation

Precision Agriculture: Development of sensors and web-based applications for farm management
Data Science: Statistical modeling and data visualization for agricultural insights
Sustainable Farming: Technology solutions for improved agricultural practices




My academic journey has taken me through rigorous training in agricultural technology, remote sensing, and data science. I have developed expertise in both theoretical foundations and practical applications of technology in agriculture.



I believe in the power of technology to transform agriculture and make farming more efficient, sustainable, and productive. My work bridges the gap between cutting-edge research and practical applications that can directly benefit farmers and agricultural communities.



Feel free to reach out if you‚Äôd like to collaborate on research, discuss agricultural technology, or learn more about my work.
Email: gustavo.togeirodealckmin@missouri.edu
Current Position: Postdoc Researcher
Institution: University of Missouri
Department: Missouri Forage and Livestock Program

title: Welcome
text:
What I Do







Remote Sensing
Development of satellite-based time-series techniques for biomass estimation and precision agriculture applications.









Machine Learning
Applying cutting-edge ML algorithms to agricultural data for improved crop monitoring and yield prediction.









Data Science
Transforming complex agricultural datasets into actionable insights using R, Python, and advanced analytics.

title: Professional Experience
text:
My career spans academia, entrepreneurship, and industry, with a focus on agricultural technology, remote sensing, and data science.





University of Missouri | Columbia, MO, United States


August 2021 - Present

Working with the Missouri Forage and Livestock Program to develop innovative solutions for precision pasture management.
Key Responsibilities: - Development of Remote Sensing Techniques, particularly satellite-based time-series, for biomass estimation - Development of canopy-height sensor and web-based applications - Scientific Writing and Publication - Collaboration with interdisciplinary research teams
Research Focus: - Satellite imagery analysis for agricultural monitoring - Machine learning applications in precision agriculture - Sensor development for field-based measurements - Web application development for farm management tools






Wageningen University & University of Tasmania | Netherlands & Australia


May 2016 - May 2021

Conducted doctoral research focusing on agricultural remote sensing and precision farming technologies.
Key Responsibilities: - Experimental Design and Research Plan Development - Data Collection and Analysis using advanced statistical methods - Scientific Writing and Publication in peer-reviewed journals - International collaboration between European and Australian institutions
Research Achievements: - Developed novel approaches to crop monitoring using satellite data - Advanced understanding of precision agriculture applications - Published research in high-impact agricultural and remote sensing journals






AB Ag Imagery | S√£o Paulo State, Brazil


April 2014 - August 2015

Founded and led a startup focused on agricultural imagery and remote sensing services.
Key Responsibilities: - Development of UAV and sensing business plan - Seed Funding acquisition and investor relations - Development of Proposal for R&D of multispectral cameras for agriculture - Business development and client acquisition - Technical product development
Achievements: - Successfully secured seed funding for agricultural technology startup - Developed innovative UAV-based sensing solutions for Brazilian agriculture - Created business partnerships with agricultural producers - Advanced R&D in multispectral imaging technology






Czarnikow | S√£o Paulo, SP, Brazil


October 2010 - August 2011

Worked with a leading international sugar trading company with operations since 1861.
Key Responsibilities: - Sugar Trading Assistance to Brazil‚Äôs Raw Sugar Market - Development of exotic structures for molasses hedging - Business Intelligence for sugar industrial consumers - Market analysis and risk assessment - Client relationship management
Achievements: - Contributed to Brazil‚Äôs raw sugar market operations - Developed innovative financial instruments for agricultural commodities - Provided strategic business intelligence to industrial clients - Gained deep understanding of agricultural commodity markets

At the University of Missouri, I‚Äôm actively involved in cutting-edge research that combines remote sensing, machine learning, and agricultural applications. My work contributes to:

Sustainable Agriculture: Developing tools for more efficient resource use
Precision Farming: Creating technology for site-specific crop management
Data-Driven Decisions: Providing farmers with actionable insights
Technology Transfer: Bridging research and practical applications
